channel.title: English help
channel.description: So i had to read this book 'A walk in the woods' by bill bryson and im having an essay test tomorrow. Has anyone actually read it or has a nice summary of what happens? Ive tried spark notes and for once in my life, Google has failed me.

item.description:
@Dregen wrote:

No problem, good luck.

its 274 pages and that skimming idea seems like it’ll work out, thanks.

item.title: English help
item.dc:creator: @Dregen Dregen
item.description:
@Dregen wrote:

I don’t think that Wikipedia link is going to work out. There not much information in it, or at least not enough for a summary. I doubt most of the material in that is mentioned in the book.

How many pages does it have? If it doesn’t contain very many, like 100 - 200, just skim it, and summarize it. I once had to read this extremely boring book for English class for a semester test, and I skimmed practically 4/5 of what I read in the book (which was about 100 pages), and I remembered half of that.

Even if it has tons more pages, skim some of it, skip some that you wouldn’t mention in a summary, and read on to another part. Like, skim one chapter till you know what’s going on, then skip to the next chapter and try to link what happened in the last one to that one.

Read full topic

item.title: English help
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

A Walk in the Woods (book)

A Walk in the Woods: Rediscovering America on the Appalachian Trail is a 1998 autobiographical book by travel writer Bill Bryson, describing his attempt to walk the Appalachian Trail with his friend "Stephen Katz". The book is written in a humorous style, interspersed with more serious discussions of matters relating to the trail's history, and the surrounding sociology, ecology, trees, plants, animals and people. The book starts with Bryson explaining his curiosity about the Appalachian Trail n...
